title: The Universal Statistical Structure and Scaling Laws of Chaos and Turbulence. (arXiv:2311.01358v1 [cond-mat.stat-mech])
abstract: Turbulence is a complex spatial and temporal structure created by the strong non-linear dynamics of fluid flows at high Reynolds numbers. Despite being an ubiquitous phenomenon that has been studied for centuries, a full understanding of turbulence remained a formidable challenge. Here, we introduce tools from the fields of quantum chaos and Random Matrix Theory (RMT) and present a detailed analysis of image datasets generated from turbulence simulations of incompressible and compressible fluid flows. Focusing on two observables: the data Gram matrix and the single image distribution, we study both the local and global eigenvalue statistics and compare them to classical chaos, uncorrelated noise and natural images. We show that from the RMT perspective, the turbulence Gram matrices lie in the same universality class as quantum chaotic rather than integrable systems, and the data exhibits power-law scalings in the bulk of its eigenvalues which are vastly different from uncorrelated clas

translated_title: 混沌和湍流的普适统计结构和尺度律
translated_abstract: 湍流是由于高雷诺数流体流动的强非线性动力学而形成的复杂的时空结构。尽管湍流是一个普遍存在的现象，并且已经研究了几个世纪，但对湍流的完全理解仍然是一个巨大的挑战。在这里，我们引入了量子混沌和随机矩阵理论(RMT)的工具，并对由不可压缩和可压缩流体流动产生的图像数据集进行了详细分析。我们关注两个可观察量：数据Gram矩阵和单个图像分布，研究了局部和全局特征值统计并将其与经典混沌、不相关噪声和自然图像进行了比较。我们表明，从RMT的角度来看，湍流的Gram矩阵与量子混沌而不是可积系统处于相同的普适类别中，并且数据在其特征值的大部分上表现出与不相关的经典类别完全不同的幂律缩放。
tldr: 该论文通过应用量子混沌和随机矩阵理论的工具，对湍流模拟图像数据进行了详细分析，并将其与经典混沌、不相关噪声和自然图像进行了比较。研究结果表明，湍流的Gram矩阵与量子混沌系统处于同一普适类别，并且数据的特征值在大部分情况下显示出与不相关系统完全不同的幂律缩放。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a detailed analysis of image datasets generated from turbulence simulations using tools from quantum chaos and Random Matrix Theory (RMT). The findings show that the turbulence Gram matrices belong to the same universality class as quantum chaotic systems, and the data exhibits power-law scalings that are vastly different from uncorrelated systems.
